tuv.seg: Shopping from home is also known as distance selling and includes purchases made by e-mail, fax, telephone, internet shopping and mail order
Tugtar ciandíol, chomh maith, ar shiopadóireacht a dhéanamh ón mbaile agus áirítear leis rudaí a ceannaíodh ar ríomhphost, facs, guthán, trí shiopadóireacht a dhéanamh ar an idirlíon agus postdíol
Distance selling involves communication between a trader and a consumer where they are not in each other's physical presence
Cumarsáid idir trádálaí agus tomhaltóir atá i gceist le ciandíol nuair nach mbíonn siad i gcuideachta fhisiciúil a chéile
When you enter into a distance contract with a trader you have the right to expect the same consumer protection as you would have if you bought the goods in a local shop
Nuair a iontrálann tú i gconradh le trádálaí, tá an ceart agat bheith ag súil leis an gcosaint tomhaltóra chéanna a fháil a gheofá dá gceannófá na hearraí i siopa áitiúil
The goods should be of merchantable quality, fit for the purpose intended and as described
Ba cheart go mbeadh na hearraí ar chaighdeán indíoltachta, oiriúnach dá gcuspóir beartaithe agus de réir an chuir síos a ndearnadh orthu
Because you are entering into a distance contract you have additional protection under EU law
Mar gheall go bhfuil tú ag iontráil i gcianchonradh, tugtar breis cosanta duit faoi dhlí an AE

The European Directive on consumer rights (Directive 2011/83/EU) (known as the Consumer Rights Directive) aims to ensure that consumers can expect the same minimum level of protection no matter where a trader is based in the European Union (EU)

Tá sé de chuspóir na Treorach Eorpaí maidir le cearta tomhaltóirí (Treoir 2011/83/AE) (ar a dtugtar an Treoir maidir le Cearta Tomhaltóirí) a chinntiú gur féidir le tomhaltóirí bheith ag súil leis an leibhéal íosta cosanta is cuma cá mbíonn trádálaí bunaithe san Aontas Eorpach (AE)
The Directive was incorporated into Irish law by the European Union (Consumer Information, Cancellation and Other Rights) Regulations 2013 (SI 484/2013) with effect from 13 June 2014
Uimh. 484/2013) le héifeacht ón 13 Meitheamh 2014
Remember, you are protected whether you purchase the goods in Ireland or another member state
Cuimhnigh, tá tú faoi chosaint cibé acu má cheannaíonn tú na hearraí in Éirinn nó i mBallstát eile
If you buy from a website or a catalogue based outside the EU, any problems that arise may be more difficult to solve - so check the terms and conditions

D’fhorbair an Lárionad Eorpach do Thomhaltóirí na Danmhairge láithreán gréasáin – theshoppingassistant.com – chun cabhrú le tomhaltóirí a dheimhniú cibé acu an bhfuil nó nach bhfuil láithreán gréasáin iontaofa nuair a bhítear ag siopadóireacht ar líne
Under the Consumer Rights Directive:
Faoin Treoir maidir le Cearta Tomhaltóirí:
• Unless agreed otherwise, the trader must deliver the goods to you without undue delay and not later than 30 days from when the order was placed
• Mura gcomhaontaítear a mhalairt, ní mór don trádálaí na hearraí a sheachadadh chugat gan moill mhíchuí agus tráth nach déanaí ná 30 lá ón uair a rinneadh an t-ordú
• If the trader does not deliver the goods within the time agreed, you may ask the trader to make the delivery within an additional period of time, unless it is not appropriate in the circumstances

• Mura seachadann an trádálaí na hearraí laistigh den amfhráma lenar comhaontaíodh, féadfaidh tú iarraidh ar an trádálaí an seachadadh a dhéanamh laistigh de thréimhse bhreise ama, mura cuí sin faoi na cúinsí

• If the trader fails to deliver the goods within the agreed time or the additional period (if any), you may reject the contract and the trader must refund all the money you paid under the contract, without undue delay

• Má theipeann ar an trádálaí na hearraí a sheachadadh laistigh den amfhráma lenar comhaontaíodh nó laistigh den tréimhse bhreise (más ann di), féadfaidh tú an conradh a dhiúltú agus ní mór don trádálaí an t-airgead go léir a d’íoc tú faoi gconradh a aisíoc, gan moill mhíchuí
The Directive does not apply to certain types of contracts, including:
Ní bhaineann an Treoir le saghsanna áirithe de chonarthaí, lena n-áirítear:
• Social services and healthcare contracts
• Seirbhísí sóisialta agus conarthaí cúram sláinte
• Contracts for financial services like insurance or banking
• Conarthaí do sheirbhísí airgeadais ar nós árachais nó baincéireachta
• Contracts for the sale of land
• Conarthaí chun talamh a dhíol
• Contracts for the construction of new buildings or substantial conversions
• Conarthaí chun foirgnimh nua a thógáil nó chun tiontuithe substainteacha a dhéanamh
• Residential accommodation rental contracts
• Conarthaí cíosa cóiríocht chónaithe
• Timeshares and long-term holiday product contracts
• Comhroinnt ama agus conarthaí táirge saoire fhadtéarmaigh
• Contracts for food and drink delivered to the consumer by regular roundsmen (for example, milkmen). However, once-off transactions are covered
• Conarthaí do bhia agus deoch a sheachadann cúrsóirí rialta (mar shampla, fir bhainne) chuig an tomhaltóir Tá idirbhearta aonuaire cumhdaithe, áfach
• Contracts concluded by means of automatic vending machines or automated commercial premises
• Conarthaí a chuirtear i gcrích trí mheaisíní uathoibríocha díola nó áitribh thráchtála uathoibrithe
• Contracts concluded with telecommunications operators through the use of public payphones
• Conarthaí a chuirtear i gcrích le hoibreoirí teileachumarsáide trí tháillefóin phoiblí a úsáid
Before you are bound by a distance contract the trader must make certain information available to you including:
Sula mbíonn tú faoi cheangal cianchonartha, ní mór don trádálaí roinnt faisnéise a chur ar fáil duit, lena n-áirítear:
• The trader's name and address as well as the address to which to address complaints
• Ainm agus seoladh an trádálaí, mar aon leis an seoladh a seolfar gearáin chuige
• The main characteristics of the goods or service
• Príomhshaintréithe na n-earraí nó na seirbhíse
• The price of the goods - including all taxes
• Praghas na n-earraí – gach cáin san áireamh
• Delivery costs, where applicable
• Costais seachadta, sa chás gurb infheidhme
• The trader’s complaints handling policy
• Beartas um láimhseáil gearán an trádálaí
• Whether a right to cancel exists and the conditions, time limit and procedures for doing so
• Cibé acu an bhfuil nó nach bhfuil an ceart agat chun cealú a dhéanamh agus na coinníollacha, an teorainn ama agus na nósanna imeachta chun amhlaidh a dhéanamh
• Whether you will bear the costs of returning the goods
• Cibé acu an íocfaidh nó nach n-íocfaidh tú as costas na n-earraí a sheoladh ar ais
• The estimated cost of returning the goods if you have to bear the cost and they cannot be returned by normal post
• An costas measta atá ar na hearraí a sheoladh ar ais, más gá duit íoc as an gcostas agus murar féidir iad a sheoladh ar ais sa ghnáthphost
• Conditions of after-sale customer assistance and services, and commercial guarantees
• Coinníollacha maidir le cúnamh agus seirbhísí i ndiaidh an díola, agus ráthaíochtaí tráchtála
• The duration of the contract, if applicable, and the conditions for terminating it if it is extended automatically or is of unlimited duration
• Fad an chonartha, más infheidhme, agus na coinníollacha chun é a chur chun deiridh má shíntear go huathoibríoch é nó má bhaineann fad neamhtheoranta leis
• The minimum duration of your obligations under the contract, if applicable
• Fad íosta do dhualgas faoin gconradh, más infheidhme
• The cost of communication between you and the trader, if it is above a basic rate
• Costas na cumarsáide idir tú féin agus an trádálaí, má tá sé os cionn bunráta
The information on digital content, such as downloadable films and books, must be clear as to the compatibility of the digital content with different hardware and software
Ní mór go bhfuil an fhaisnéis ar ábhar digiteach, ar nós scannáin agus leabhair in-íoslódáilte, soiléir maidir le comhoiriúnacht an ábhair dhigitigh i dtaobh crua-earraí agus bogearraí éagsúla
It must also include any technical protection measures, for example, the number of copies that can be made
Anuas air sin, ní mór go gcuirfear san áireamh aon bearta um chosaint theicniúil, mar shampla, an líon cóipeanna is féidir a dhéanamh
If a right to cancel exists, the trader must make available to you the standard cancellation form (including cancellation rights and instructions) as set out in the Directive

Má tá an ceart agat chun cealú a dhéanamh, ní mór go gcuirfidh an trádálaí an fhoirm chaighdeánach chealaithe ar fáil duit (lena n-áirítear cearta agus treoracha cealaithe) faoi mar a leagtar amach sa Treoir

Where a distance contract is concluded through a trading website, the website must indicate clearly, and at the latest at the beginning of the ordering process, whether any delivery restrictions apply and which means of payment are accepted

Sa chás go gcuirtear cianchonradh i gcrích trí láithreán gréasáin trádála, ní mór go gcuirfear in iúl go soiléir ar an láithreán gréasáin, agus ag tús an phróisis ordaithe, ar a dhéanaí, cibé acu an mbaineann nó nach mbaineann aon srianta seachadta agus cén bealaí íocaíochtaí lena nglactar
Where a distance contract is concluded by electronic means the trader must ensure that, when placing an order, you explicitly acknowledge that the order implies an obligation to pay

Sa chás go gcuirtear cianchonradh i gcrích trí bhealaí leictreonacha, ní mór don trádálaí a chinntiú, nuair a bhíonn an t-ordú á dhéanamh, go n-aithníonn tú go sainráite go mbíonn dualgas ort íocaíocht a dhéanamh mar gheall ar an ordú a dhéanamh

If this entails activating a button or something similar, the trader must ensure that the button is labelled with the words ‘order with obligation to pay’ or similar, indicating that the order entails an obligation to pay the trader

Má bhíonn cnaipe a ghníomhachtú nó a mhacasamhail de ghníomh i gceist leis seo, ní mór don trádálaí a chinntiú go bhfuil an cnaipe lipéadaithe leis na focail ‘déan ordú agus beidh dualgas ort íoc’ nó a mhacasamhail, a thugann le fios go mbíonn dualgas ort an trádálaí a íoc má dhéanann tú ordú
If this requirement is not complied with, you are not bound by the contract
Mura gcomhlíontar an ceanglas seo, níl tú faoi cheangal ag an gconradh
The use of default options, for example, pre-ticked boxes, which you are required to change in order to avoid paying for some additional service or item is not allowed
Ní cheadaítear roghanna réamhshocraithe a úsáid, mar shampla, boscaí atá réamhthiceáilte, a bhíonn ort a athrú lena sheachaint íoc as seirbhísí nó earra éigin breise
You must actively select such options otherwise you do not have to pay
Ní mór duit na roghanna sin a roghnú le gníomh, nó níl ort íoc astu
If there is a dispute, the trader is required to prove that he sought your express consent to the additional payment
Má thagann díospóid aníos, tá ar an trádálaí a chruthú gur lorg sé/sí do thoiliú sainráite an íocaíocht bhreise a dhéanamh
A trader cannot charge you more for using a particular means of payment, such as a credit card, than the cost to the trader for using that means of payment
Ní féidir le trádálaí níos mó a ghearradh ort as modh ar leith íocaíochta a úsáid, ar nós cárta creidmheasa, ná an costas a ghearrtar ar an trádálaí as an modh sin íocaíochta a úsáid
If there is a dispute, the trader is required to prove they are compliant with the Directive
Má thagann díospóid aníos, tá ar an trádálaí a chruthú go gcomhlíonann siad an Treoir
Similarly, if a trader operates a telephone helpline, the trader cannot charge you more than the basic telephone rate for calls to it
Ar an nós céanna, má oibríonn trádálaí lín chabhrach gutháin, ní féidir leis an trádálaí níos mó ná an bunráta gutháin a ghearradh ort ar ghlaonna a chuirtear ar an líne
The trader must provide confirmation of the concluded contract to you in a durable format, such as a letter or email
Ní mór don trádálaí deimhniú a sholáthar den chonradh a cuireadh i gcrích duit i mbuanfhormáid, ar nós litreach nó ríomhphoist
It should include the information mentioned above, if not already supplied in a durable format
Ba cheart go n-áireofaí leis an fhaisnéis a luaitear thuas, murar soláthraíodh í cheana féin i mbuanfhormáid
It should be provided within a reasonable time after the contract was concluded, and at the latest:
Ba cheart é a bheith soláthartha duit laistigh de thréimhse réasúnta i ndiaidh gur cuireadh an conradh i gcrích, agus ag a dhéanaí:
• When the goods are being delivered or
• Nuair atá na hearraí á seachadadh nó
You are entitled to a cooling-off period of 14 days, which begins on the day that you receive the goods
Tá tú i dteideal ré aithrí 14 lá, a thosaíonn ar an lá a fhaigheann tú na hearraí
In the case of a service, the cooling-off period begins on the day the contract for distance selling was concluded
I gcás seirbhíse, tosaíonn an tréimhse aithrí ar an lá a cuireadh i gcrích an conradh le haghaidh ciandíola
In the case of digital content, the cooling-off period expires when the downloading or streaming starts
I gcás ábhar digiteach, éagann an tréimhse aithrí nuair a thosaítear an íoslódáil nó an sruthú
During the cooling-off period, you can cancel a distance contract without giving a reason and without incurring charges or penalties, other than possible charges incurred in returning the goods
I rith na ré aithrí, féadfaidh tú cianchonradh a chur ar ceal gan cúis a thabhairt agus gan muirir nó pionóis a thabhú, seachas muirir fhéideartha a thabhaítear nuair a sheoltar na hearraí ar ais
If a trader fails to provide you with information on the right to cancel, the cooling-off period is extended to 12 months from the date it would have expired if the information had been provided
Má theipeann ar thrádálaí faisnéis a sholáthar duit ar an gceart chun cealú a dhéanamh, síntear an ré aithrí go dtí 12 mhí ón dáta a d’éagfadh sé dá soláthrófaí an fhaisnéis
If the trader provides the information within this 12-month period, the cooling-off period expires within 14 days of the consumer receiving it
Má sholáthraíonn an trádálaí an fhaisnéis laistigh den tréimhse 12 mhí seo, éagann an ré aithrí laistigh de 14 lá i ndiaidh go bhfaigheann an tomhaltóir í
To cancel the contract, you must inform the trader of the decision to cancel using either the prescribed cancellation form, or some other method, before the cooling-off period expires

Chun an conradh a chealú, ní mór duit an trádálaí a chur ar an eolas ar an gcinneadh chun cealú a dhéanamh agus an fhoirm fhorordaithe chealaithe a úsáid, nó modh éigin eile, sula n-éagann an ré aithrí
There is no requirement to give a reason for cancelling
Níl aon cheanglas ort cúis a thabhairt le cealú a dhéanamh
If there is a dispute, it is up to you to prove the cancellation was carried out correctly
Má thagann díospóid aníos, is fútsa atá sé a chruthú gur tugadh faoin gcealú i gceart
You must send the goods back within 14 days of informing the trader of the cancellation
Ní mór duit na hearraí a sheoladh ar ais laistigh de 14 lá tar éis an trádálaí a chur ar an eolas ar an gcealú
You have to pay for the cost of returning the goods unless you were not informed before ordering that you would have to bear the cost
Tá ort íoc as an gcostas a bhíonn ar na hearraí a sheoladh ar ais, murar cuireadh ar an eolas thú sula ndearna tú an t-ordú go mbeadh ort íoc as an gcostas
Upon cancellation, the trader is obliged to repay all payments you made, including delivery charges, within 14 days
Ar chealú, tá dualgas ar an trádálaí gach íocaíocht a rinne tú a aisíoc, lena n-áirítear muirir sheachadta, laistigh de 14 lá
If you choose a more expensive type of delivery than the trader’s cheapest standard delivery, you are only entitled to be refunded the cost of the cheaper delivery type
Má roghnaíonn tú saghas níos costasaí de sheachadadh ná seachadadh caighdeánach is saoire an trádálaí, níl tú i dteideal aisíocaíocht a fháil ach don saghas is saoire de sheachadadh
The trader can withhold repayment until the goods are returned or you supply evidence that you have sent the goods back
Féadfaidh an trádálaí aisíocaíocht a shiarchoinneáil go dtí go seoltar na hearraí ar ais nó go soláthraíonn tú fianaise gur sheol tú na hearraí ar ais
Once the contract is cancelled, any credit agreements entered into at the time of the contract are cancelled as well
A luaithe a chealaítear an conradh, cealaítear aon chomhaontuithe creidmheasa ina n-iontráiltear ag tráth an chonartha chomh maith
Cancellation will not be accepted in certain cases including where:
Ní ghlacfar le cealú i roinnt cásanna, lena n-áirítear:
• The provision of services have already begun with your agreement
• Tá tús curtha cheana féin leis an soláthar seirbhísí le do chomhaontú
• The price of the goods or services is dependent upon financial market fluctuations that are beyond the trader's control
• Braitheann praghas na n-earraí nó na seirbhísí ar luaineacht an mhargaidh airgeadais nach bhfuil smacht ag an trádálaí uirthi
• The goods cannot be returned because they were made according to your specifications or were personalised for you
• Ní féidir na hearraí a sheoladh ar ais mar gheall go ndearnadh iad de réir do chuid sonraíochtaí nó rinneadh iad a phearsantú duit
• The goods are liable to deteriorate or expire rapidly
• D’fhéadfadh na hearraí imeacht i léig nó éag go mear
• The goods seals have been broken by you and cannot be returned for health protection and hygiene reasons
• Bhris tú séalaí na n-earraí agus ní féidir iad a sheoladh ar ais ar chúiseanna um chosaint sláinte agus sláinteachais
• The goods are audio/video tapes or computer software whose seals have been broken by you
• Clostéipeanna/fístéipeanna nó bogearraí ríomhaire iad na hearraí ar bhris tú a séalaí
• The goods are newspapers or magazines
• Nuachtáin nó irisleabhair iad na hearraí
• The goods were purchased at a public auction
• Ceannaíodh na hearraí ag ceant poiblí
Tax payable on goods
Cáin atá iníoctha ar earraí
If you buy goods online or by mail from another EU Member State you may pay VAT at the rate that applies in Ireland
Má cheannaíonn tú earraí ar líne nó sa phost ó Bhallstát AE eile, féadfaidh tú CBL a íoc ar an ráta a ghearrtar in Éirinn

However, if the supplier that you are buying the goods from has not exceeded the Distance Sales Threshold in Ireland then you will pay VAT at the rate appropriate to that product in the Member State of purchase

Murar sháraigh an soláthraí óna bhfuil na hearraí á gceannach agat an Tairseach Chiandíolachán in Éirinn, áfach, íocfaidh tú CBL ar an ráta atá cuí i dtaobh an earra sin sa Bhallstát inar cheannaigh tú an táirge
You will usually be informed of the amount of VAT payable at checkout
Is gnách go gcuirfear ar an eolas thú ar mhéid an CBL atá iníoctha ar sheiceáil amach
Goods ordered from outside the EU that cost more than €22 may be liable for VAT
D’fhéadfadh earraí a ordaítear ó áiteanna lasmuigh den AE a chosnaíonn níos mó ná €22 a bheith dlite le haghaidh CBL
If they cost more than €150 they may also be liable for customs duty
Má chosnaíonn siad breis agus €150, d’fhéadfaidís a bheith faoi dhliteanas dleacht chustaim
Excise duty and VAT are chargeable on excisable products such as alcohol and alcoholic beverages, tobacco and tobacco products and mineral oils forwarded from other member states of the EU
Gearrtar dleacht máil agus CBL ar tháirgí inmháil ar nós alcóil agus deochanna alcóil, tobac agus táirgí tobac agus olaí mianracha a chuirtear ar aghaidh ó bhallstáit eile an AE
You can find more information on Revenue’s website
Féadfaidh tú teacht ar bhreis faisnéise ar láithreán gréasáin na gCoimisinéirí Ioncaim
If you return the goods you purchased, you may be able to reclaim the taxes and duties charged providing you have the required paperwork
Má chuireann tú na hearraí a cheannaigh tú ar ais, d’fhéadfá bheith in ann na cánacha agus na dleachtanna a gearradh a aiséileamh, a fhad agus a bhíonn an páipéarachas riachtanach agat
Contact your local Revenue office for more information
Déan teagmháil le hoifig áitiúil na gCoimisinéirí Ioncaim chun teacht ar bhreis faisnéise
If your credit card has been used fraudulently, you can cancel any payments made under a distance contract and you are entitled to the return of those payments immediately
Má baineadh úsáid chalaoiseach as do chárta creidmheasa, féadfaidh tú aon íocaíochtaí a rinneadh faoi chianchonradh a chealú agus tá tú i dteideal na híocaíochtaí siúd a fháil ar ais láithreach
Payments can be cancelled by contacting the bank or building society where you hold your credit card
Féadtar íocaíochtaí a chealú trí theagmháil a dhéanamh leis an mbanc nó leis an gcumann foirgníochta lena bhfuil do chárta creidmheasa nasctha
You should always keep the telephone number in a safe place in case you need it
Ba cheart duit an uimhir ghutháin a choimeád in áit shábháilte i gcónaí sa chás go dteastódh sí uait
If you discover (or even suspect) that your card has been used in a fraudulent manner, then you should contact the relevant financial institution straight away
Más léir duit (nó fiú má tá amhras ort) gur úsáideadh do chárta ar bhealach calaoiseach, ba cheart duit teagmháil a dhéanamh leis an institiúid ábhartha airgeadais caol díreach
If your card has been used fraudulently, your liability cannot exceed €150 under EU Recommendation 97/489/EC
Má baineadh úsáid chalaoiseach as do chárta, ní féidir le do dhliteanas €150 a shárú faoi Mholadh 97/489/CE an AE
However, in Ireland, in practice the liability is generally lower
Is gnách go mbíonn an dliteanas in Éirinn níos ísle ná sin, de réir an chleachtais de, áfach
It is illegal for a trader to demand payment for unsolicited services
Tá sé in aghaidh an dlí má éilíonn trádálaí íocaíocht as seirbhísí gan iarraidh
Book clubs are a very good example of inertia selling and the most common kind
Cumainn leabhar iad sampla an-mhaith de dhíol gan iarraidh agus tá siad ar an saghas is coitianta
If a trader sends you an item that you did not order and does not provide for return post, it cannot then try to invoice you for the product or initiate debt collection proceedings against you

Má dhíolann trádálaí earra leat nár ordaigh thú agus mura ndéanann sé/sí soláthar don phostas ar ais chuige/chuici, ní féidir leis an trádálaí iarracht a dhéanamh sonrasc a sheoladh duit don táirge nó tús a chur le himeachtaí bailithe fiachais i do choinne
However, if you are contracted to a trader and receive unwanted books or CDs, you should check your contract as it may contain a term that commits you to receiving 4 or 5 items a year

Má tá tú ar conradh le trádálaí agus má fhaigheann tú leabhair nó dlúthdhioscaí gan iarraidh, ba cheart duit do chonradh a sheiceáil mar gheall go bhféadfadh go gcuimsítear ann téarma a leagann dualgas ort 4 nó 5 earra sa bhliain a fháil
If this is the case, the trader's actions cannot be considered inertia selling
Más amhlaidh an cás, ní féidir caitheamh le gníomhartha an trádálaí mar dhíol gan iarraidh
It is therefore very important for you to read the contract carefully before committing yourself to it
Tá sé an-tábhachtach, ar an ábhar sin, go léann tú an conradh sula dtugann tú gealltanas dó
Waiving your rights as a consumer
Do cheart mar thomhaltóir a tharscaoileadh
You cannot waive the rights conferred on you by the Consumer Rights Directive
Ní féidir leat na cearta a bhronnann an Treoir maidir le Cearta Tomhaltóirí ort a tharscaoileadh
When making a complaint, you should firstly contact the trader and inform them of your complaint
Nuair a bhíonn gearán á dhéanamh agat, ba cheart duit, ar an gcéad dul síos, teagmháil a dhéanamh leis an trádálaí agus iad a chur ar an eolas faoi do ghearán
If you are not satisfied with the response, you may be able to get help with your complaint
Mura bhfuil tú sásta leis an bhfreagairt, d’fhéadfá bheith in ann cabhair a fháil le do ghearán
If your complaint is against a trader here in Ireland, then you should complain to the Competition and Consumer Protection Commission (CCPC), which has responsibility for enforcing the Regulations

Má tá do ghearán i gcoinne trádálaí anseo in Éirinn, ba cheart duit an gearán a dhéanamh leis an gCoimisiún um Iomaíocht agus Cosaint Tomhaltóirí (an CICT), atá freagrach as na Rialacháin a fhorfheidhmiú
The CCPC can appoint officers to search, inspect and remove documents from the premises of offending traders
Féadfaidh an CICT oifigigh a cheapadh chun cáipéisí a chuardach, a iniúchadh agus a bhaint ó áitreabh trádálaí ciontaithe
If a trader fails to comply with legal obligations, then the distance contract will be rendered unenforceable
Má theipeann ar thrádálaí dualgais dhlíthiúla a chomhlíonadh, caithfear leis an gcianchonradh mar chonradh nach féidir a chur i bhfeidhm
The supplier is then exposed to the risk of criminal prosecution and fines of up to €60,000 or up to 18 months in prison, or to both
Tá an soláthraí i mbaol ansin go gcúiseofar é/í agus go ngearrfar fíneálacha a mhéid le €60,000 air/uirthi nó go ngearrfar a fhad le18 mí sa phríosún air/uirthi, nó an dá rud

If the trader is in another EU member state, you can contact the European Consumer Centre Ireland (ECC Ireland) which is part of the European Consumer Centres Network (ECC-Net) and it may contact the trader and try to resolve your dispute

Má tá an trádálaí i mballstát eile an AE, féadfaidh an trádálaí teagmháil a dhéanamh leis an Lárionad Eorpach do Thomhaltóirí (ECC Éireann) atá mar chuid de Líonra na Lárionad Eorpach do Thomhaltóirí (ECC-Net)
If appropriate, ECC Ireland may forward your case to an alternative dispute resolution (ADR) organisation in the other country
Déanfaidh siad teagmháil leis an trádálaí agus déanfaidh siad iarracht do dhíospóid a réiteach
ADR should be considered, before legal action, as an opportunity to settle a dispute out of court, if your attempts to resolve the dispute directly with a trader proved unsuccessful
Mura n-éiríonn leis seo, cuirfidh ECC Éireann do chás faoi bhráid eagraíocht Mhalartach chun Díospóidí a Réiteach (ADR) sa tír eile. Níor cheart ADR a úsáid ach mar rogha deiridh
You can get further information on ADR in the EU by contacting ECC Ireland
Féadfaidh tú breis faisnéise a fháil ar ADR san AE trí theagmháil a dhéanamh le ECC Éireann
The online dispute resolution (ODR) Regulation (SI 500/2015) came into effect on 9 January 2016
Tháinig in éifeacht ar an 9 Eanáir 2016 Rialachán um réiteach díospóidí ar líne (RDAL) (IR 500/2015)

A new online ODR platform developed and operated by the European Commission acts as a single point of contact for consumers and traders, within the EU, who seek to resolve disputes arising from online shopping

Feidhmíonn clár nua RDAL, a rinne an Coimisiún Eorpach a fhorbairt agus a chur i bhfeidhm, mar phointe aonair teagmhála idir tomhaltóirí agus trádálaithe na hEorpa ar mhaith leo díospóidí a eascraíonn as siopadóireacht ar líne a réiteach
If the trader is based outside the EU, you can direct your complaint to Econsumer.gov after you have tried to solve the problem directly with the seller
Má tá an trádálaí bunaithe lasmuigh den AE, féadfaidh tú do ghearán a chur faoi bhráid Econsumer.gov tar éis go ndearna tú iarracht an fhadhb a réiteach go díreach leis an díoltóir
Econsumer.gov also tries to protect consumers from internet scams
Déanann Econsumer.gov iarracht tomhaltóirí a chosaint ó chamscéimeanna idirlín chomh maith
ECC Ireland has published a leaflet on online shopping (pdf)
D’fhoilsigh ECC Éireann bileog ar shiopadóireacht idirlín (pdf)
The Competition and Consumer Protection Commission website contains information on buying online
Cuimsítear ar láithreán gréasáin an Choimisiúin um Iomaíocht agus Cosaint Tomhaltóirí faisnéis ar cheannach ar líne
